intro: Edgeworthia longipes, commonly known as the Chinese snowball or winter jasmine, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Hydrangeaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are dark green and glossy, providing contrast to its delicate blooms. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in partial shade. Edgeworthia longipes is also valued in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits.
